intro: Anogeissus dhofarica, commonly known as the Dhofar acacia, is a small evergreen tree native to the southern Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-white flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, exhibiting drought resistance and a deep root system. It produces small, woody pods containing seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is also valued for its timber.
